description: Retrieves the metadata for a given workflow run. Job run history is accessible for 90 days for your workflow and job run.

parameters.name: Name
parameters.description: Name of the workflow being run.

parameters.name: RunId
parameters.description: The ID of the workflow run.

nested_items.name: Name
nested_items.description: Name of the workflow that was run.

nested_items.name: WorkflowRunId
nested_items.description: The ID of this workflow run.

nested_items.name: PreviousRunId
nested_items.description: The ID of the previous workflow run.

nested_items.name: WorkflowRunProperties
nested_items.description: The workflow run properties which were set during the run.
(string) ---
(string) ---

nested_items.name: StartedOn
nested_items.description: The date and time when the workflow run was started.

nested_items.name: CompletedOn
nested_items.description: The date and time when the workflow run completed.

nested_items.name: Status
nested_items.description: The status of the workflow run.

nested_items.name: ErrorMessage
nested_items.description: This error message describes any error that may have occurred in starting the workflow run. Currently the only error message is 'Concurrent runs exceeded for workflow: foo.'

nested_items.name: Statistics
nested_items.description: The statistics of the run.

nested_items.name: TotalActions
nested_items.description: Total number of Actions in the workflow run.

nested_items.name: TimeoutActions
nested_items.description: Total number of Actions that timed out.

nested_items.name: FailedActions
nested_items.description: Total number of Actions that have failed.

nested_items.name: StoppedActions
nested_items.description: Total number of Actions that have stopped.

nested_items.name: SucceededActions
nested_items.description: Total number of Actions that have succeeded.

nested_items.name: RunningActions
nested_items.description: Total number Actions in running state.

nested_items.name: ErroredActions
nested_items.description: Indicates the count of job runs in the ERROR state in the workflow run.

nested_items.name: WaitingActions
nested_items.description: Indicates the count of job runs in WAITING state in the workflow run.

nested_items.name: Nodes
nested_items.description: A list of the the Glue components belong to the workflow represented as nodes.

nested_items.name: Type
nested_items.description: The type of Glue component represented by the node.

nested_items.name: Name
nested_items.description: The name of the Glue component represented by the node.

nested_items.name: UniqueId
nested_items.description: The unique Id assigned to the node within the workflow.

nested_items.name: TriggerDetails
nested_items.description: Details of the Trigger when the node represents a Trigger.

nested_items.name: Name
nested_items.description: The name of the trigger.

nested_items.name: WorkflowName
nested_items.description: The name of the workflow associated with the trigger.

nested_items.name: Id
nested_items.description: Reserved for future use.

nested_items.name: Type
nested_items.description: The type of trigger that this is.

nested_items.name: State
nested_items.description: The current state of the trigger.

nested_items.name: Description
nested_items.description: A description of this trigger.

nested_items.name: Schedule
nested_items.description: A cron expression used to specify the schedule (see Time-Based Schedules for Jobs and Crawlers. For example, to run something every day at 12:15 UTC, you would specify: cron(15 12 * * ? *).

nested_items.name: Actions
nested_items.description: The actions initiated by this trigger.

nested_items.name: JobName
nested_items.description: The name of a job to be run.

nested_items.name: Arguments
nested_items.description: The job arguments used when this trigger fires. For this job run, they replace the default arguments set in the job definition itself.
(string) ---
(string) ---

nested_items.name: Timeout
nested_items.description: The JobRun timeout in minutes. This is the maximum time that a job run can consume resources before it is terminated and enters TIMEOUT status. This overrides the timeout value set in the parent job.

nested_items.name: SecurityConfiguration
nested_items.description: The name of the SecurityConfiguration structure to be used with this action.

nested_items.name: NotificationProperty
nested_items.description: Specifies configuration properties of a job run notification.

nested_items.name: NotifyDelayAfter
nested_items.description: After a job run starts, the number of minutes to wait before sending a job run delay notification.

nested_items.name: CrawlerName
nested_items.description: The name of the crawler to be used with this action.

nested_items.name: Predicate
nested_items.description: The predicate of this trigger, which defines when it will fire.

nested_items.name: Logical
nested_items.description: An optional field if only one condition is listed. If multiple conditions are listed, then this field is required.

nested_items.name: Conditions
nested_items.description: A list of the conditions that determine when the trigger will fire.

nested_items.name: LogicalOperator
nested_items.description: A logical operator.

nested_items.name: JobName
nested_items.description: The name of the job whose JobRuns this condition applies to, and on which this trigger waits.

nested_items.name: State
nested_items.description: The condition state. Currently, the only job states that a trigger can listen for are SUCCEEDED, STOPPED, FAILED, and TIMEOUT. The only crawler states that a trigger can listen for are SUCCEEDED, FAILED, and CANCELLED.

nested_items.name: CrawlerName
nested_items.description: The name of the crawler to which this condition applies.

nested_items.name: CrawlState
nested_items.description: The state of the crawler to which this condition applies.

nested_items.name: EventBatchingCondition
nested_items.description: Batch condition that must be met (specified number of events received or batch time window expired) before EventBridge event trigger fires.

nested_items.name: BatchSize
nested_items.description: Number of events that must be received from Amazon EventBridge before EventBridge event trigger fires.

nested_items.name: BatchWindow
nested_items.description: Window of time in seconds after which EventBridge event trigger fires. Window starts when first event is received.

nested_items.name: JobDetails
nested_items.description: Details of the Job when the node represents a Job.

nested_items.name: JobRuns
nested_items.description: The information for the job runs represented by the job node.

nested_items.name: Id
nested_items.description: The ID of this job run.

nested_items.name: Attempt
nested_items.description: The number of the attempt to run this job.

nested_items.name: PreviousRunId
nested_items.description: The ID of the previous run of this job. For example, the JobRunId specified in the StartJobRun action.

nested_items.name: TriggerName
nested_items.description: The name of the trigger that started this job run.

nested_items.name: JobName
nested_items.description: The name of the job definition being used in this run.

nested_items.name: JobMode
nested_items.description: A mode that describes how a job was created. Valid values are:
SCRIPT - The job was created using the Glue Studio script editor.
VISUAL - The job was created using the Glue Studio visual editor.
NOTEBOOK - The job was created using an interactive sessions notebook.

nested_items.name: JobRunQueuingEnabled
nested_items.description: Specifies whether job run queuing is enabled for the job run.

nested_items.name: StartedOn
nested_items.description: The date and time at which this job run was started.

nested_items.name: LastModifiedOn
nested_items.description: The last time that this job run was modified.

nested_items.name: CompletedOn
nested_items.description: The date and time that this job run completed.

nested_items.name: JobRunState
nested_items.description: The current state of the job run. For more information about the statuses of jobs that have terminated abnormally, see Glue Job Run Statuses.

nested_items.name: Arguments
nested_items.description: The job arguments associated with this run. For this job run, they replace the default arguments set in the job definition itself.
(string) ---
(string) ---

nested_items.name: ErrorMessage
nested_items.description: An error message associated with this job run.

nested_items.name: PredecessorRuns
nested_items.description: A list of predecessors to this job run.

nested_items.name: JobName
nested_items.description: The name of the job definition used by the predecessor job run.

nested_items.name: RunId
nested_items.description: The job-run ID of the predecessor job run.

nested_items.name: AllocatedCapacity
nested_items.description: This field is deprecated. Use MaxCapacity instead.

nested_items.name: ExecutionTime
nested_items.description: The amount of time (in seconds) that the job run consumed resources.

nested_items.name: Timeout
nested_items.description: The JobRun timeout in minutes. This is the maximum time that a job run can consume resources before it is terminated and enters TIMEOUT status. This value overrides the timeout value set in the parent job.

nested_items.name: MaxCapacity
nested_items.description: For Glue version 1.0 or earlier jobs, using the standard worker type, the number of Glue data processing units (DPUs) that can be allocated when this job runs. A DPU is a relative measure of processing power that consists of 4 vCPUs of compute capacity and 16 GB of memory. For more information, see the Glue pricing page.
When you specify a Python shell job ( ``JobCommand.Name``='pythonshell'), you can allocate either 0.0625 or 1 DPU. The default is 0.0625 DPU.

When you specify an Apache Spark ETL job ( ``JobCommand.Name``='glueetl') or Apache Spark streaming ETL job ( ``JobCommand.Name``='gluestreaming'), you can allocate from 2 to 100 DPUs. The default is 10 DPUs. This job type cannot have a fractional DPU allocation.

nested_items.name: WorkerType
nested_items.description: The type of predefined worker that is allocated when a job runs. Accepts a value of G.1X, G.2X, G.4X, G.8X or G.025X for Spark jobs. Accepts the value Z.2X for Ray jobs.

For the G.1X worker type, each worker maps to 1 DPU (4 vCPUs, 16 GB of memory) with 94GB disk, and provides 1 executor per worker. We recommend this worker type for workloads such as data transforms, joins, and queries, to offers a scalable and cost effective way to run most jobs.

For the G.2X worker type, each worker maps to 2 DPU (8 vCPUs, 32 GB of memory) with 138GB disk, and provides 1 executor per worker. We recommend this worker type for workloads such as data transforms, joins, and queries, to offers a scalable and cost effective way to run most jobs.

For the G.4X worker type, each worker maps to 4 DPU (16 vCPUs, 64 GB of memory) with 256GB disk, and provides 1 executor per worker. We recommend this worker type for jobs whose workloads contain your most demanding transforms, aggregations, joins, and queries. This worker type is available only for Glue version 3.0 or later Spark ETL jobs in the following Amazon Web Services Regions: US East (Ohio), US East (N. Virginia), US West (Oregon), Asia Pacific (Singapore), Asia Pacific (Sydney), Asia Pacific (Tokyo), Canada (Central), Europe (Frankfurt), Europe (Ireland), and Europe (Stockholm).

For the G.8X worker type, each worker maps to 8 DPU (32 vCPUs, 128 GB of memory) with 512GB disk, and provides 1 executor per worker. We recommend this worker type for jobs whose workloads contain your most demanding transforms, aggregations, joins, and queries. This worker type is available only for Glue version 3.0 or later Spark ETL jobs, in the same Amazon Web Services Regions as supported for the G.4X worker type.

For the G.025X worker type, each worker maps to 0.25 DPU (2 vCPUs, 4 GB of memory) with 84GB disk, and provides 1 executor per worker. We recommend this worker type for low volume streaming jobs. This worker type is only available for Glue version 3.0 or later streaming jobs.
For the Z.2X worker type, each worker maps to 2 M-DPU (8vCPUs, 64 GB of memory) with 128 GB disk, and provides up to 8 Ray workers based on the autoscaler.

nested_items.name: NumberOfWorkers
nested_items.description: The number of workers of a defined workerType that are allocated when a job runs.

nested_items.name: SecurityConfiguration
nested_items.description: The name of the SecurityConfiguration structure to be used with this job run.

nested_items.name: LogGroupName
nested_items.description: The name of the log group for secure logging that can be server-side encrypted in Amazon CloudWatch using KMS. This name can be /aws-glue/jobs/, in which case the default encryption is NONE. If you add a role name and SecurityConfiguration name (in other words, /aws-glue/jobs-yourRoleName-yourSecurityConfigurationName/), then that security configuration is used to encrypt the log group.

nested_items.name: NotificationProperty
nested_items.description: Specifies configuration properties of a job run notification.

nested_items.name: NotifyDelayAfter
nested_items.description: After a job run starts, the number of minutes to wait before sending a job run delay notification.

nested_items.name: GlueVersion
nested_items.description: In Spark jobs, GlueVersion determines the versions of Apache Spark and Python that Glue available in a job. The Python version indicates the version supported for jobs of type Spark.

nested_items.name: DPUSeconds
nested_items.description: This field can be set for either job runs with execution class FLEX or when Auto Scaling is enabled, and represents the total time each executor ran during the lifecycle of a job run in seconds, multiplied by a DPU factor (1 for G.1X, 2 for G.2X, or 0.25 for G.025X workers). This value may be different than the executionEngineRuntime * MaxCapacity as in the case of Auto Scaling jobs, as the number of executors running at a given time may be less than the MaxCapacity. Therefore, it is possible that the value of DPUSeconds is less than executionEngineRuntime * MaxCapacity.

nested_items.name: ExecutionClass
nested_items.description: Indicates whether the job is run with a standard or flexible execution class. The standard execution-class is ideal for time-sensitive workloads that require fast job startup and dedicated resources.

nested_items.name: MaintenanceWindow
nested_items.description: This field specifies a day of the week and hour for a maintenance window for streaming jobs. Glue periodically performs maintenance activities. During these maintenance windows, Glue will need to restart your streaming jobs.

nested_items.name: ProfileName
nested_items.description: The name of an Glue usage profile associated with the job run.

nested_items.name: StateDetail
nested_items.description: This field holds details that pertain to the state of a job run. The field is nullable.

nested_items.name: CrawlerDetails
nested_items.description: Details of the crawler when the node represents a crawler.

nested_items.name: Crawls
nested_items.description: A list of crawls represented by the crawl node.

nested_items.name: State
nested_items.description: The state of the crawler.

nested_items.name: StartedOn
nested_items.description: The date and time on which the crawl started.

nested_items.name: CompletedOn
nested_items.description: The date and time on which the crawl completed.

nested_items.name: ErrorMessage
nested_items.description: The error message associated with the crawl.

nested_items.name: LogGroup
nested_items.description: The log group associated with the crawl.

nested_items.name: LogStream
nested_items.description: The log stream associated with the crawl.

nested_items.name: Edges
nested_items.description: A list of all the directed connections between the nodes belonging to the workflow.

nested_items.name: SourceId
nested_items.description: The unique of the node within the workflow where the edge starts.

nested_items.name: DestinationId
nested_items.description: The unique of the node within the workflow where the edge ends.

nested_items.name: StartingEventBatchCondition
nested_items.description: The batch condition that started the workflow run.

nested_items.name: BatchSize
nested_items.description: Number of events in the batch.

nested_items.name: BatchWindow
nested_items.description: Duration of the batch window in seconds.
